question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Coca-Cola not recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola does not announce a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must not be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and not reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must not specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If such a recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with a YES if, on or before August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola declares a recall for any of its items due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially acknowledged by Coca-Cola or an appropriate food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and be reported by at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal substances present in the food products. If no such recall happens within the given timeframe, the question will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

not_P.title: Will Illinois not hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must not be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must not be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must not directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if such a referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must not be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for Illinois to conduct a public vote on healthcare reform before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois formally carries out a public vote aimed at implementing healthcare reform within the state. The public vote must be officially declared by the Illinois Secretary of State or another relevant state election authority, and it must be arranged to occur on or before August 31, 2024. The question posed in the public vote must specifically pertain to the topic of healthcare reform. This inquiry will be answered with NO if no such public vote is officially declared or executed by the given date. It is important to note that simply collecting signatures for a possible public vote does not meet the criteria for a YES answer; the actual public vote must be planned or conducted within the designated timeframe.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania hold a referendum on renewable energy initiatives by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on implementing renewable energy initiatives in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on renewable energy initiatives.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum occurs or is completed by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Proposed referendums that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date do not count for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will Pennsylvania not hold a referendum on renewable energy initiatives by August 2024?

2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on renewable energy initiatives.
3. The results of the referendum must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum occurs or is completed by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Proposed referendums that have been officially conducted by the resolution date count for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will no other U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan without a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, no U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that does not include a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be no official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post) regarding such a plan. The plan must not be officially adopted, but merely proposed or under consideration. If at least one other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for another U.S. state to implement a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state, excluding Georgia, formally implements a Medicaid plan that features a community engagement requirement for its beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be an essential element of the plan. For a positive outcome, there should be an official declaration from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent coverage from at least two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially enacted, not just suggested or under review. If no other state establishes such a plan by July 31, 2024, the inquiry will conclude as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

Conversely, it will be answered with NO if this situation does not occur within the given timeframe. For the purposes of resolution, only official statistics published by the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account.

question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company not be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has not fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must not be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must not be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must not be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions not transferred.

Complete relocations or plans completed by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides in favor of the move, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will a prominent cybersecurity firm have entirely moved its headquarters to Austin, Texas?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, a notable cybersecurity firm has completely shifted its headquarters from its previous location to Austin, Texas. For a YES outcome:

1. The company or its management must make an official announcement regarding the move.
2. This announcement needs to be covered by at least two major and credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters in Austin, Texas, must be operational, with essential executive roles transferred.

Any partial moves or plans that are still underway by July 31, 2024, will not qualify for a YES resolution. If the relocation is not finalized and functioning by this deadline, or if the company opts not to proceed with the move, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will Google face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

question.title: Will Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for freight train operations, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad does not announce and implement a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The implementation must not be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must not be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. If such a system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does specifically target schedule predictability for freight train operations, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Union Pacific introduce a new freight train scheduling system by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad publicly announces and puts into operation a new scheduling system intended to enhance the predictability of freight train schedules. Confirmation of the implementation must come from official company communications or be reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as the Associated Press, Reuters, or prominent national newspapers). The occurrence must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The question will resolve as NO if either of these referendums occurs by the specified date or if any planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024.

The inquiry will be resolved as negative if neither referendum takes place by the specified date or if any scheduled referendum is cancelled or postponed past July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will X's AI chatbot Grok be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that the AI chatbot Grok on the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Grok and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Texas enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if at least one of the following takes place by July 31, 2024: (a) Texas passes new legislation or regulations that impose more rigorous requirements on abortion providers than those for other medical providers. More rigorous requirements may encompass, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards that are specific to abortion providers. If no such legislation or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any laws or regulations enacted are applied uniformly across all medical providers, this segment of the question will resolve as NO. (b) Alabama officially holds a statewide vote concerning abortion rights. The vote must pertain to embedding abortion rights within the state constitution or making significant changes to current abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the vote must be officially declared by the Alabama state government, and the electoral process must be finalized by the resolution date. The occurrence and outcomes of the vote must be reported by at least two major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such vote is conducted or completed by July 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO. It is important to note that simply scheduling a future vote beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Google announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% by August 2024?

question.title: Will the U.S. government resume consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal government has officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). The resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The resumption should involve the active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant federal agencies. If no such resumption occurs by the resolution date, or if the pause on consideration remains in effect, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the approval of any specific projects, only the resumption of the consideration process.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the UK economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does enter a recession. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

A recession is characterized for this question as two successive quarters of declining GDP growth, as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The answer will be NO if the UK economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

3. The results of the referendum must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. A referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is not cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, and it specifically focuses on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it does not take place within the specified timeframe.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account the results of the public vote, only whether it occurs within the designated timeframe.

question.title: Will the FTC announce completion of a major pricing practices investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics. The investigation must involve at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, nor the FTC announce completion of a major pricing practices investigation by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution, the referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government, explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection, and the results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. The question will resolve as NO if such a referendum occurs by August 31, 2024, a planned referendum is not cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date, or a referendum is held that specifically focuses on enshrining protection for abortion rights. Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics. The investigation must involve at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC announces the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is no longer ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Georgia will conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, or that the FTC will declare the conclusion of a significant investigation into pricing practices by July 2024?

The inquiry will be deemed negative if no such vote is conducted by August 31, 2024, a scheduled vote is cancelled or postponed beyond the stated deadline, or a vote occurs but does not specifically aim to establish protections for abortion rights. Note: This inquiry does not take into account the results of the vote, only whether it occurs within the designated timeframe.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces that it has finished its investigation into pricing strategies that utilize personal data to determine prices based on individual shopper traits. The investigation must encompass at least five major firms. Confirmation of completion must come through an official FTC announcement or be reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC fails to announce the conclusion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation remains ongoing, the inquiry resolves as negative.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of New Zealand announce a new economic stimulus package by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of New Zealand officially announces a new economic stimulus package. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of New Zealand communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of New Zealand. The announcement should explicitly describe the new economic stimulus package. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of New Zealand maintains the current economic policy, the question resolves as NO.

The announcement should not explicitly describe a new economic stimulus package. The announcement must not be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of New Zealand changes the current economic policy, the question resolves as NO.

If there is no such declaration by the given date, or if the Central Bank of New Zealand continues with its existing economic policy, the inquiry will be resolved as negative.

question.title: Will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?

The 3,500 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. If the index does not reach 3,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will Pennsylvania not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for Pennsylvania to hold a vote on abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania holds a public vote aimed explicitly at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES outcome, the following conditions must be fulfilled:

1. The vote must be formally announced and carried out by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The main subject of the vote must center on the protection of abortion rights.
3. The results of the vote must be made public through official state channels or reputable news outlets.

If no such vote that satisfies these conditions occurs by August 31, 2024, the answer will be NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a vote without actually executing it by the deadline does not qualify for a YES response.

question.title: Will Missouri remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If a bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed that meets all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

4. The legislation must be characterized as 'significant' or 'major' by these news outlets concerning its potential effects on the UK economy.

If no such legislation is approved by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a legislation is approved but fails to satisfy all the aforementioned criteria, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Apple finalize a union contract with store employees in Ohio by July 2024?

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will GNC Holdings emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024?

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Sergey Brin must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Italian economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy enters a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Italy's economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by the end of July 2024, Italy's economy has not slipped into a recession. For the context of this question, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The inquiry will be considered negative if Italy's economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

not_P.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase not exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase less than or equal to 0.5% in every single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If at least one month shows such an increase during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will there be a monthly rise in the Federal Reserve's favored inflation indicator that surpasses 0.5%?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Federal Reserve's favored inflation indicator (commonly the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) indicates a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any single month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially acknowledged by the Federal Reserve or a pertinent U.S. government agency (like the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by a minimum of two reliable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such rise is noted during this timeframe, the inquiry will be deemed negative. It is important to emphasize that this question pertains to the month-over-month variation, rather than year-over-year or any other duration.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession, meaning it does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics, and (b) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current Nipah virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing Nipah virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If either of these events occurs by their respective resolution dates, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Bank of England will declare a reduction in interest rates by August 2024, or that India will remove export duties on agricultural goods by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if either of the following takes place: (a) The Bank of England makes an official declaration regarding a reduction in interest rates to go into effect by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be validated through official communications from the Bank of England, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses made by Bank officials. It is important to note that the actual date for the implementation of the rate reduction can occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which serves as the primary instrument for the Bank of England's monetary policy. (b) The Indian government makes an official announcement or enforces a policy to entirely abolish export duties on agricultural goods by July 31, 2024. This policy must be verified through official government communications or reported by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). A partial reduction in export duties or the removal of duties on select agricultural products will not suffice for a YES resolution. If neither of these conditions is met by their respective deadlines, the question will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will India's central bank's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

not_P.title: Will India's central bank's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase of 0.5% or less by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase of 0.5% or less in every single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If any month shows an increase greater than 0.5% during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: Will the inflation metric preferred by India's central bank experience a monthly rise surpassing 0.5% by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if the inflation metric favored by India's central bank indicates a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. The rise must be officially reported by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant government body in India and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Economic Times). If there is no such increase reported within this timeframe, the inquiry will conclude as NO. It is important to note that this question pertains to the month-over-month change, rather than year-over-year or any other period.

question.title: Will Uber lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Uber has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Uber confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

not_P.title: Will Uber not lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Uber has not confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. The layoffs must not be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Uber confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

para_P.title: Will Uber terminate a minimum of 1,800 staff members by July 2024?

The job cuts must be directly associated with the AI-centered restructuring plan revealed in 2023. If Uber verifies a lesser number of terminations, or if no such confirmation meeting these conditions is provided by the resolution date, the question will conclude as NO. Partial terminations or gradual implementations that do not achieve the 1,800 employee benchmark by the resolution date will also result in a NO conclusion.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Satya Nadella on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Satya Nadella on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Satya Nadella must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

3. Satya Nadella must not be the interviewee.
4. The event must not be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must not be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must not report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If any of these conditions are not met by August 31, 2024, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as YES.

If all these requirements are fulfilled by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will resolve as YES. If any of these requirements are not met by that date, or if the discussion does not take place, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Nvidia announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Nvidia officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Nvidia's AI systems. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced measures do not specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Astellas allow generic production of its prostate cancer drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Astellas officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its prostate cancer drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Astellas continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

This could be through a formal patent retention, a refusal of a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that restricts generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If such an announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Astellas ceases to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the European Central Bank not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank does not officially announce a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The absence of an announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The lack of an interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is the European Central Bank expected to declare a reduction in interest rates before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the European Central Bank formally reveals a reduction in its primary refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The declaration must be validated through official communications from the ECB or reported by a minimum of two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and conveyed in their official statement or press briefing following a meeting. Any conjectures regarding potential future rate reductions or unofficial remarks by individual ECB members will not be taken into account for resolution. If no such formal announcement of an interest rate reduction occurs by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves as negative.

question.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.body:

question.title: Will the Mexican economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Mexican economy enter a recession by July 2024?

question.title: Will Samsung announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Samsung publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Samsung only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

para_P.title: Will Samsung reveal intentions to expand its workforce focused on AI by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, Samsung makes a public declaration regarding its intentions to expand its workforce dedicated to AI. The declaration must be communicated through official company channels (such as press releases, statements for investors, or verified social media accounts) or covered by at least two prominent news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The intention to expand the AI-related workforce must be clearly articulated and not merely deduced from broader hiring strategies. If no such declaration is made by the deadline, or if Samsung only indicates plans to maintain or reduce its AI-related workforce, the inquiry will be deemed negative. It is important to note that this question pertains to the announcement of intentions, rather than the actual execution of those intentions.

question.title: Will the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's climate disclosure rule be reinstated by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's rule on climate disclosures, previously blocked by a court decision, is reinstated. The reinstatement must be confirmed by official court documents or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The reinstatement could occur through a successful appeal, a reversal of the court's decision, or any other legal mechanism that results in the rule taking effect. If the rule remains blocked or is not reinstated by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the NASDAQ Composite index reach or exceed 15,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the NASDAQ Composite index reaches or exceeds 15,000 points. The 15,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the NASDAQ Stock Market. If the index does not reach 15,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 15,000 points.

question.title: Will California conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will California not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, California holds a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The vote must be officially declared and carried out by the state of California.
2. The main objective of the vote must be to protect abortion rights.
3. The results of the vote must be publicly disclosed through official state channels or reputable news organizations.

If no such vote occurs that meets these requirements by August 31, 2024, the question will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a vote without actually executing it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES outcome.

question.title: Will Oregon hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Oregon state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will the Philippine government enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. The enforcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. If no such enforcement meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Philippine government not enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are no confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. The enforcement must not be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and must not involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' in this context means not at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must not be a result of government policy or directive, but due to voluntary closures or economic factors. If such enforcement meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Philippine authorities implement a closure of online trading platforms operated by Chinese entities by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are verified reports indicating that the Philippine authorities have effectively implemented a closure of online trading platforms managed by Chinese entities in the Philippines. The enforcement must be reported by a minimum of two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and require official governmental actions leading to the halting of operations for a considerable number of these trading platforms. 'Considerable' in this context refers to at least 50% of the identified Chinese-managed online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. question.title: Will the S&P 500 index reach or exceed 4,800 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points. The 4,800 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,800 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,800 points.

question.title: Will Shopify lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Shopify has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Shopify confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will the FDA approve MDMA as a therapy for PTSD by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially approves MDMA (3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine) for use as a therapy for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the approval must be confirmed through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The approval must specifically be for the use of MDMA in treating PTSD, not for any other condition or use. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly rejects or delays the approval beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will the FDA not approve MDMA as a therapy for PTSD by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) does not officially approve MDMA (3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine) for use as a therapy for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the approval must not be confirmed through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The approval must specifically not be for the use of MDMA in treating PTSD, or it may be for any other condition or use. If such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly approves or accelerates the approval before August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will MDMA receive FDA approval for PTSD treatment by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) grants official approval for MDMA (3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine) to be utilized as a treatment for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024. For a positive outcome, this approval must be validated through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The approval must specifically pertain to the application of MDMA in addressing PTSD, rather than any other condition or purpose. If such approval is not issued by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly denies or postpones the approval past August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will Mexican authorities officially declare the dismantling of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Mexican authorities (such as federal law enforcement agencies or high-ranking government officials) make an official public declaration stating that the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or major Mexican news sources). The declaration should indicate a significant disruption to the cartel's leadership structure, operations, or ability to function as a cohesive criminal entity. Mere arrests of individual members or partial disruptions to the cartel's activities do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such official declaration meeting these criteria is made by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Mexican authorities not officially declare the dismantling of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Mexican authorities (such as federal law enforcement agencies or high-ranking government officials) do not make an official public declaration stating that the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. The declaration must not be reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or major Mexican news sources). The declaration should not indicate a significant disruption to the cartel's leadership structure, operations, or ability to function as a cohesive criminal entity. Mere arrests of individual members or partial disruptions to the cartel's activities do not qualify for a YES resolution. If such an official declaration meeting these criteria is made by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will there be an official announcement from Mexican officials regarding the disbandment of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, before the end of July 2024, Mexican officials (including federal law enforcement agencies or senior government representatives) issue a formal public statement declaring that the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. This statement must be reported by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or prominent Mexican media). The announcement should reflect a significant disruption to the cartel's leadership, operations, or its capacity to operate as a unified criminal group. Simple arrests of individual members or minor disruptions to the cartel's activities will not suffice for a YES response. If no such formal declaration that meets these conditions is made by July 31, 2024, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will the FDA approve MDMA as a therapy for PTSD by August 2024? (b) Will Mexican authorities officially declare the dismantling of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel by July 2024?

The approval must specifically be for the use of MDMA in treating PTSD, not for any other condition or use. (b) Mexican authorities (such as federal law enforcement agencies or high-ranking government officials) make an official public declaration by July 31, 2024, stating that the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or major Mexican news sources). The declaration should indicate a significant disruption to the cartel's leadership structure, operations, or ability to function as a cohesive criminal entity. Mere arrests of individual members or partial disruptions to the cartel's activities do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such official declaration meeting these criteria is made by July 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

If both (a) and (b) resolve as YES, then this combined question will resolve as YES. Otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) Will the FDA not approve MDMA as a therapy for PTSD by August 2024? (b) Will Mexican authorities not officially declare the dismantling of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel by July 2024?

The absence of a declaration should indicate that there has not been a significant disruption to the cartel's leadership structure, operations, or ability to function as a cohesive criminal entity. If such an official declaration meeting these criteria is made by July 31, 2024, this part will resolve as YES.

If at least one of (a) or (b) resolves as YES, then this combined question will resolve as YES. Otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

(b) Mexican officials (including federal law enforcement agencies or senior government representatives) issue a public statement by July 31, 2024, confirming that the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal entity. This statement must be covered by at least two reputable international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or prominent Mexican news agencies). The announcement should reflect a substantial disruption to the cartel's leadership, operations, or capacity to function as a unified criminal organization. Simple arrests of individual members or partial disruptions to the cartel's activities do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such official statement meeting these requirements is made by July 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

If both (a) and (b) conclude as YES, then this combined inquiry will resolve as YES. Otherwise, it will resolve as NO.
