question.title: Will the Central Bank of Israel announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Israel officially announces a decrease in its interest rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Israel or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Israel members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Israel not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Israel does not officially announce a decrease in its interest rate by July 31, 2024. The lack of an announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Israel or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The absence of an interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Israel members will not count for resolution. If such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Central Bank of Israel will declare a reduction in interest rates before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Central Bank of Israel makes a formal announcement regarding a reduction in its interest rate by July 31, 2024. The confirmation must come from official communications from the Central Bank of Israel or be reported by a minimum of two prominent financial news outlets (like Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official decision taken by the Monetary Committee and conveyed in their formal statement or during a press conference after a meeting. Any conjecture about potential future rate reductions or unofficial remarks by individual members of the Central Bank of Israel will not be sufficient for resolution. If there is no official announcement of an interest rate reduction by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will resolve as negative.

question.title: Will large protests occur in the United Kingdom in response to healthcare funding cuts by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in the United Kingdom specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will large protests not occur in the United Kingdom in response to healthcare funding cuts by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are no credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in the United Kingdom specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve fewer than 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling fewer than 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must not be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are not rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Are significant demonstrations expected in the UK due to reductions in healthcare funding by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are reliable reports from a minimum of two prominent international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) indicating that significant demonstrations have taken place in the United Kingdom specifically in reaction to the government's cuts to healthcare funding. To be considered 'significant', the demonstrations must involve no fewer than 1,000 participants in a single event or multiple coordinated events with a combined total of at least 1,000 participants throughout the United Kingdom. The demonstrations must be directly associated with the matter of healthcare funding cuts. If such demonstrations that meet these criteria do not occur by the given date, or if the funding cuts are revoked before leading to such demonstrations, the inquiry will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

If the rate exceeds 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must not surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any time during August 2024, the answer will be NO. To clarify, the rate must be greater than 5.5%, not just equal to it.

If the wage is reduced below $11 per hour at any point by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'fast food workers' refers to employees in fast food restaurants as defined by Nevada state law.

question.title: Will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its Tostitos brand by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Tostitos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for Tostitos in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will PepsiCo not report increased North American demand for its Tostitos brand by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo does not report an increase in North American demand for its Tostitos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. para_P.title: By July 2024, will there be a rise in North American demand for Tostitos as reported by PepsiCo?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo indicates a rise in North American demand for its Tostitos brand relative to the demand figures from the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be substantiated through official earnings announcements or statements from PepsiCo and corroborated by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The increase in demand should be explicitly mentioned or clearly suggested in the company's financial disclosures or official communications. If no such rise is documented by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports a continued drop or stagnation in Tostitos demand in North America, the inquiry will be marked as negative.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 200,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 200,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

not_P.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims not exceed 200,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, does not exceed 200,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

para_P.title: Will the number of weekly unemployment claims in the U.S. surpass 200,000 for a duration of four straight weeks before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if the weekly initial unemployment claims in the United States, as published by the U.S. Department of Labor, go beyond 200,000 for four successive weeks at any time from now until August 31, 2024. It will be answered with NO if this scenario does not occur within the given timeframe. Only official figures released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be used for resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) PepsiCo reports increased North American demand for Tostitos by July 2024 (b) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 200,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body:
(a) This part will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Tostitos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for Tostitos in North America, the question will resolve as NO.
(b) This part will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 200,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered. The combined question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) PepsiCo reports increased North American demand for Tostitos by July 2024 nor (b) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 200,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This part will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo does not report an increase in North American demand for its Tostitos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The absence of an increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should not be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If such an increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports an increase in demand for Tostitos in North America, the question will resolve as NO.
(b) This part will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, does not exceed 200,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered. The combined question will resolve as YES only if neither (a) nor (b) resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) By July 2024, PepsiCo will announce a rise in North American interest in Tostitos, and (b) the number of U.S. weekly jobless claims will surpass 200,000 for four straight weeks by August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This segment will be considered YES if, on or before July 31, 2024, PepsiCo indicates an increase in North American interest in its Tostitos product line compared to the second quarter of 2023. This increase must be verified through official earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and covered by at least two credible news outlets (like Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The rise in demand should be clearly articulated or strongly suggested in the company's financial results or official communications. Should there be no such increase reported by the deadline, or if PepsiCo states a continued drop or stagnation in Tostitos demand in North America, the answer will be NO.
(b) This segment will be marked YES if the weekly initial jobless claims in the U.S., as provided by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceed 200,000 for four consecutive weeks at any time before August 31, 2024. The answer will be NO if this scenario does not occur within the given timeframe. For resolution, only official data from the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account. The overall question will be answered YES only if both (a) and (b) are answered YES.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of Australia announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of Australia officially announces a decrease in its cash rate target by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of Australia or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Reserve Bank Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBA members will not count for resolution. question.title: Will Washington maintain its $16 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers through July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, as of July 31, 2024, the minimum wage for fast food workers in Washington remains at $16 per hour or higher. The wage must be confirmed through official Washington state announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). If the wage is reduced below $16 per hour at any point by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'fast food workers' refers to employees in fast food restaurants as defined by Washington state law.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 7.0%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 7.0% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 7.0%, not merely equal it.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India impose new regulatory curbs on Yes Bank's lending by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announces new regulatory curbs specifically targeting Yes Bank's lending practices. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the RBI or reported by at least two major Indian financial news outlets (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). These new curbs must be distinct from any existing regulations as of October 1, 2023, and must directly impact Yes Bank's lending operations. If no such new curbs are announced by the specified date, or if any announced curbs do not specifically target Yes Bank's lending practices, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India not impose new regulatory curbs on Yes Bank's lending by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) does not announce new regulatory curbs specifically targeting Yes Bank's lending practices. These new curbs must be distinct from any existing regulations as of October 1, 2023, and must not directly impact Yes Bank's lending operations. If any such new curbs are announced by the specified date, or if any announced curbs do specifically target Yes Bank's lending practices, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India introduce additional restrictions on Yes Bank's lending activities by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) declares new restrictions aimed specifically at Yes Bank's lending activities. The declaration must be validated by official communications from the RBI or reported by at least two prominent Indian financial news organizations (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). These new restrictions must be separate from any current regulations effective as of October 1, 2023, and must have a direct effect on Yes Bank's lending operations. If no such new restrictions are declared by the given date, or if any declared restrictions do not specifically focus on Yes Bank's lending activities, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will the Food and Agriculture Organization announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Food and Agriculture Organization officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official FAO channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Food and Agriculture Organization not announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?

The funding commitments must not be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, or must be continuations of previously announced commitments. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments exceeds $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

The financial commitments should represent new initiatives or substantial expansions of current programs, rather than extensions of previously disclosed commitments. If no such declaration occurs by the resolution date, or if the cumulative new financial commitments do not surpass $400 million, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will the Bank of Korea announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of Korea publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of Korea and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the base rate, which is the Bank of Korea's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for two consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for two consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. question.title: Will New York hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the New York state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

not_P.title: Will New York not hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the New York state government.
2. The referendum must not explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. A referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is announced and conducted within the specified date.
3. A referendum is held that specifically focuses on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it does not take place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for New York to conduct a public vote on abortion rights before August 2024?

3. The results of the public vote must be made available through official state channels or reputable news outlets.

The inquiry will be answered with NO if:

1. No such public vote takes place by August 31, 2024.
2. An anticipated public vote is either cancelled or postponed past the given date.
3. A public vote occurs, but it does not concentrate on establishing protections for abortion rights.

Note: This inquiry does not evaluate the outcome of the public vote, only whether it occurs within the designated timeframe.

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?

If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. question.title: Will Alibaba Group resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Alibaba Group reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Alibaba Group workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as YES.

para_P.body:

4. The resolution must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no resolution that satisfies all these conditions is reached by the stated deadline, or if no significant strike takes place, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will large protests occur in Indonesia in response to religious freedom legislation by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Indonesia specifically in response to new religious freedom legislation. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Indonesia. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of religious freedom legislation. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the legislation is rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy.

If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement does not specifically focus on work schedule predictability, this aspect will resolve as FALSE.

2. By July 31, 2024, Colorado has officially rolled out a plan for community college that is free of charge. The plan must be part of a comprehensive state initiative, not restricted to specific schools or pilot programs. If no such implementation takes place by the resolution date, or if the implementation is only partial or limited in scope, this aspect will resolve as FALSE.

The overall inquiry will resolve as TRUE only if both components resolve as TRUE.

question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

The question resolves as NO if the French economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Los Angeles by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Los Angeles, California. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Los Angeles rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Tim Scott publicly retract his statement about Biden's stance on criminal justice reform?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Tim Scott publicly retracts or significantly alters his statement regarding Joe Biden's position on criminal justice reform. A significant alteration would involve a substantial change to the core message of his original statement, not just a minor clarification or rewording. para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the Global Fund formally discloses one or more new funding pledges that cumulatively surpass $400 million. The disclosures must occur via official Global Fund platforms (such as their website or press releases) and be covered by a minimum of two credible news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding pledges should represent new initiatives or considerable enhancements of existing programs, rather than extensions of previously announced commitments. If no such disclosures occur by the resolution date, or if the sum of new funding pledges does not exceed $400 million, the inquiry resolves as negative.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the Zika outbreak over by August 2024 and the Global Fund announce over $400 million in new commitments by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur: (a) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing Zika virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. (b) The Global Fund officially announces new funding commitments totaling more than $400 million by July 31, 2024. The announcement(s) must be made through official Global Fund channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If either condition is not met by the respective resolution dates, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will the WHO not declare the Zika outbreak over by August 2024 or the Global Fund not announce over $400 million in new commitments by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) The World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare the ongoing Zika virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. This declaration must not be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. (b) The Global Fund does not officially announce new funding commitments totaling more than $400 million by July 31, 2024. The announcement(s) must not be made through official Global Fund channels (such as their website or press releases) and not be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must not be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, and must be continuations of previously announced commitments. If both conditions are met by the respective resolution dates, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Nicholas Collon be recognized as the youngest music director of a major orchestra by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Nicholas Collon is officially recognized and announced by at least two reputable music industry publications or organizations as the youngest music director of a major orchestra. The recognition must be based on his age at the time of his appointment to a major orchestra, such as the London Philharmonic. A 'major orchestra' is defined as a professional symphony orchestra with international recognition and a regular concert season. The recognition must explicitly state that he is the youngest person to hold such a position. If no such recognition occurs by the specified date, or if another conductor is recognized as younger in such a role, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Spain's IBEX 35 index reach or exceed 10,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points. The 10,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Bolsa de Madrid. If the index does not reach 10,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 10,000 points.

question.title: Will Netflix announce a new major sports media partnership by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Netflix publicly announces a new partnership related to major sports media rights or broadcasting. The partnership must be with a major sports league, organization, or event (such as NFL, MLB, NBA, FIFA World Cup, Olympics, etc.). The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Bloomberg, CNBC). Minor partnerships or those not primarily focused on sports media rights or broadcasting will not qualify. If no such announcement meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Netflix not announce a new major sports media partnership by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Netflix does not publicly announce a new partnership related to major sports media rights or broadcasting. The partnership must not be with a major sports league, organization, or event (such as NFL, MLB, NBA, FIFA World Cup, Olympics, etc.). The announcement must not be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Bloomberg, CNBC). question.title: Will the NFL settle the 'Sunday Ticket' antitrust case for less than $4.7 billion by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if by July 31, 2024, the NFL reaches a settlement in the 'Sunday Ticket' antitrust case for an amount less than $4,707,259,944. The settlement must be officially confirmed through court documents or public announcements by involved parties. If no such settlement is reached by the resolution date, or if the settlement amount is equal to or more than $4.7 billion, the question resolves as NO. For context, as of October 1, 2023, a federal jury has ordered the NFL to pay this amount for violating antitrust laws in distributing out-of-market Sunday afternoon games on a premium subscription service.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if by July 31, 2024, the NFL finalizes a resolution in the 'Sunday Ticket' antitrust lawsuit for a sum less than $4,707,259,944. The agreement must be officially verified through legal documents or public statements from the parties involved. If no such resolution is achieved by the deadline, or if the settlement amount is equal to or exceeds $4.7 billion, the inquiry will be deemed NO. For reference, as of October 1, 2023, a federal jury has mandated the NFL to pay this sum for breaching antitrust regulations in the distribution of out-of-market Sunday afternoon games via a premium subscription service.

question.title: Will the African Union declare the current mpox outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the African Union officially declares the ongoing mpox outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official African Union announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the African Union to issue public health warnings. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the African Union extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Illinois maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

not_P.title: Will Illinois not maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. para_P.title: Will the current legal position on abortion access in Illinois remain unchanged by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has neither overturned nor made significant changes to its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a widely used second-trimester procedure. Conversely, the inquiry will conclude as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has overturned this ruling, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the prohibition on the second-trimester procedure. The outcome will be determined based on official court rulings or credible reports from at least three prominent news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will the HHS's rule on telehealth services be enacted by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a new Department of Health and Human Services rule specifically targeting the regulation of telehealth services is enacted through legal or administrative means. Enactment must be confirmed through official announcements by the HHS, court rulings, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The rule must be effective and not merely proposed or pending. If no such rule is enacted and in effect by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that (a) Illinois will uphold its existing legal position on abortion access by July 2024 and (b) the HHS's regulation regarding telehealth services will be implemented by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) By July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has neither overturned nor substantially modified its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a widely used second-trimester procedure. The inquiry will be answered with a NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has overturned this ruling, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the prohibition on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will rely on official court rulings or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). (2) By August 31, 2024, a new rule from the Department of Health and Human Services specifically addressing the regulation of telehealth services is enacted through legal or administrative processes. The enactment must be verified through official announcements by the HHS, court decisions, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The rule must be in effect and not just proposed or pending. If no such rule is enacted and operational by August 31, 2024, the inquiry resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES only if both criteria (1) and (2) are met.

question.title: Will the United States announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on tax reform. question.title: Will Facebook's AI content moderation system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Facebook's AI content moderation system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024 and (b) Mississippi hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

1. By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, this part will resolve as NO.

2. By July 31, 2024, Mississippi officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the Mississippi state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

The combined question will resolve as YES only if both parts resolve as YES. Otherwise, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces a decrease in its bank rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of England or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoE members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Bank of England not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England does not officially announce a decrease in its bank rate by July 31, 2024. The lack of announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of England or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The absence of an interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoE members will not count for resolution. If such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

If no such official announcement regarding an interest rate reduction is made by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to cut the NASA budget by more than 20% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget cut is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions of budget cuts do not count; the bill must be officially passed by the Senate.

question.title: Will New York hold a referendum on climate change policy by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on climate change policy. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address climate change, either proposing new measures or altering existing policies. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on climate change does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the German economy avoid a recession by July 2024?

question.title: Will an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members be established by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

2. Michigan officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Michigan state government, explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection, and the results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. The question resolves as NO if at least one of these conditions is met by their respective deadlines.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will there be either a legally binding ethics code for members of the U.S. Congress or a referendum on abortion rights in Michigan by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if one of the following takes place:

1. A legally binding ethics code for U.S. Congress members is formally enacted by the United States government by July 31, 2024. This adoption must be validated by at least two significant and credible news organizations (like The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code should be enforceable, relevant to all current Congress members, and specify clear standards of behavior along with enforcement mechanisms. Simple proposals or discussions will not suffice; the code must be officially enacted and enforceable.

OR

2. Michigan carries out a public referendum aimed at securing abortion rights protection by August 31, 2024. This referendum must be officially announced and executed by the Michigan state government, directly addressing the topic of abortion rights protection, and the outcome must be reported publicly by official state outlets or well-known news agencies. The question will be marked as NO if neither of these events occurs by the given deadlines, if a planned referendum is cancelled or delayed beyond the specified date, or if a referendum takes place but does not specifically aim to secure abortion rights protection.

The question will be marked as NO if neither of these conditions is fulfilled by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will Google reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will Google not reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority do not reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must not be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should not specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If such a settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will the UK data protection authority and Google come to an agreement by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, an official settlement is established between Google and the UK data protection authority concerning a penalty levied on Google for purported breaches of data protection regulations. The agreement must be validated by official announcements from either side or covered by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should explicitly relate to the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If such an agreement is not reached or publicly acknowledged by the deadline, the inquiry will be deemed negative. It is important to note that appeals, ongoing discussions, or partial agreements do not meet the criteria for a positive resolution.

question.title: Will the European Commission implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If no such tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the European Commission not implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the European Commission does not officially implement a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must not be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and not reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must not be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and must be part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If such a tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the European Commission will impose a major tariff on solar panels produced in China by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, the European Commission officially enacts a tariff of 50% or more on the importation of solar panels made in China. The enactment must be validated through official announcements from the European Commission and reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must specifically target solar panels produced in China and should not be part of a wider tariff affecting all Chinese products or all electronic items. If such a tariff that meets these conditions is not put into effect by the given date, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) Google reaches a settlement with the UK data protection authority, and (2) The European Commission implements a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (1) Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, this condition resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution. (2) The European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If no such tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, this condition resolves as NO. Only if both conditions are met will the question resolve as YES.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by August 2024: (1) Google does not reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority, nor (2) The European Commission does not implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels?

The tariff must not specifically target solar panels manufactured in China and not be part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If such a tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, this condition resolves as NO. Only if neither condition is met will the question resolve as YES.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (1) A settlement is reached between Google and the UK data protection authority, and (2) The European Commission enforces a substantial tariff on solar panels produced in China?

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Google reaches a settlement with the UK data protection authority, or (b) the European Commission implements a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels?

para_P.title: By August 2024, will one of the following happen: (a) Google comes to an agreement with the UK data protection authority, or (b) the European Commission imposes a substantial tariff on solar panels made in China?
