If neither scenario is realized by the resolution date, the question is answered with NO.

question.title: Will Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.

not_P.title: Will Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income not increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if Mercedes-Benz does not report a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If such an increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is more than 20%, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will there be a rise in Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net profits exceeding 20% compared to the same quarter of the previous year by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if Mercedes-Benz discloses a net profit growth surpassing 20% for any quarter in relation to the corresponding quarter from the previous year, as stated in its official financial disclosures published by July 31, 2024. The growth must be substantiated through official earnings reports from the company or at least three reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If such growth is not reported by the resolution date, or if the maximum reported growth is 20% or lower, the inquiry will be deemed negative. It is important to note that this question does not focus on any particular quarter, but rather encompasses any quarter-over-quarter assessment within the designated period.

question.title: Will the Canadian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Canadian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. The question resolves as NO if the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Canadian economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Canadian economy does enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. The question resolves as NO if the Canadian economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Canada steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the Canadian economy manages to avoid a recession by July 31, 2024. For the context of this question, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as recorded by Statistics Canada. The answer will be NO if the Canadian economy faces two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year, and (b) the Canadian economy avoids a recession?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, as verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Wall Street Journal; and (b) the Canadian economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. If either Mercedes-Benz does not achieve the specified net income increase or the Canadian economy experiences a recession within the defined timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income does not increase by over 20% year-over-year, or (b) the Canadian economy enters a recession?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following conditions is met by July 31, 2024: (a) Mercedes-Benz does not report a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, as verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Wall Street Journal; or (b) the Canadian economy enters a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. If both Mercedes-Benz achieves the specified net income increase and the Canadian economy does not experience a recession within the defined timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) an increase of over 20% in Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net earnings year-over-year, and (b) the Canadian economy remains out of a recession?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024: (a) Mercedes-Benz shows a net earnings growth exceeding 20% for any quarter when compared to the same quarter from the previous year, as confirmed by official earnings reports from the company or by at least three reliable financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Wall Street Journal; and (b) the Canadian economy does not fall into a recession, which is characterized by two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. If Mercedes-Benz fails to meet the required net earnings increase or if the Canadian economy enters a recession within the specified period, the question will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will either Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year or the Canadian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if at least one of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). The increase must occur within the timeframe specified, and if no such increase is reported or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, this part resolves as NO. (b) The Canadian economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada, between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. If the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth within this period, this part resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES if either part (a) or part (b) resolves as YES.

not_P.title: Will neither Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year nor the Canadian economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if neither of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). The increase must occur within the timeframe specified, and if such an increase is reported or if the highest reported increase is more than 20%, this part resolves as NO. (b) The Canadian economy enters a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada, between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. If the Canadian economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth within this period, this part resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES if both parts (a) and (b) resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net profit to rise by more than 20% compared to the previous year, or for the Canadian economy to steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if at least one of the following conditions is met by July 31, 2024: (a) Mercedes-Benz announces a net profit increase exceeding 20% for any quarter relative to the same quarter of the prior year, confirmed through official earnings announcements from the company or by at least three reliable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Wall Street Journal). The increase must take place within the designated timeframe, and if no such increase is reported or if the highest reported increase is 20% or lower, this aspect will be considered NO. (b) The Canadian economy remains out of a recession, which is defined as experiencing two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada, between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. If the Canadian economy does undergo two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth during this timeframe, this aspect will be marked as NO. The overall question will be regarded as YES if either aspect (a) or aspect (b) is marked as YES.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remain at or above 13.25% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate fall below 13.25% at any point in August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be below 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have remained at or above 13.25% throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Brazil's Central Bank maintain the Selic rate at 13.25% or higher throughout August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if the Selic rate set by Brazil's Central Bank is documented at 13.25% or above at any time during August 2024. Verification must be obtained from official announcements by the Central Bank of Brazil or at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Folha de S.Paulo). Conversely, if the rate is reported to have fallen below 13.25% and stays below this threshold for the entirety of August 2024, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

not_P.title: Will Argentine agricultural workers not remain on strike through August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are not still on strike and have fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have not fully returned to work and normal operations have not resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

para_P.title: Will agricultural laborers in Argentina continue their strike until August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if, by August 31, 2024, agricultural laborers in Argentina are still engaged in a strike or have not completely returned to normal operations following any ongoing labor conflict. The confirmation of the strike's status or the resumption of work must come from official announcements made by agricultural organizations, the unions that represent the workers, or the Argentine government, and must be reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have entirely resumed their duties and normal operations have been restored prior to or during August 2024, the answer will be negative. Any partial return to work or limited operations will not be considered a complete resolution of the strike.

question.title: Will both of the following occur in August 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remains at or above 13.25% and (b) Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024, confirmed by official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo), and (b) By August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute, confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur in August 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remains at or above 13.25% nor (b) Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024, confirmed by official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo), and (b) By August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute, confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If either condition is met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: In August 2024, will the following be true: (a) The Selic rate of the Central Bank of Brazil stays at or exceeds 13.25% and (b) Argentine agricultural laborers continue their strike?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (a) The Selic rate from the Central Bank of Brazil is documented to be at or above 13.25% at any time throughout August 2024, validated by official announcements from the Central Bank of Brazil or at least two reliable financial news outlets (like Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo), and (b) By the end of August 2024, agricultural laborers in Argentina are still on strike or have not completely returned to regular operations after any ongoing labor conflict, verified by official communications from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by a minimum of two trustworthy news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If either of the conditions is not fulfilled, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by the end of August 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remains at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024, or (b) Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024?

Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, this part resolves as NO. (b) By August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, this part resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by the end of August 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remains below 13.25% at any point during August 2024, nor (b) Argentine agricultural workers fully resume normal operations by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be below 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have remained at or above 13.25% throughout August 2024, this part resolves as NO. (b) By August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina have fully resumed normal operations or are not still on strike following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers are still on strike or have not fully returned to work before or during August 2024, this part resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do count as a full resolution of the strike.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of August 2024, will one of the following take place: (a) The Selic rate set by the Central Bank of Brazil stays at or exceeds 13.25% at any time in August 2024, or (b) Agricultural laborers in Argentina continue their strike throughout August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is documented to be at or above 13.25% at any moment during August 2024. Verification must be sourced from official announcements by the Central Bank of Brazil or at least two credible financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is noted to have dropped below 13.25% and stays below this threshold for the entirety of August 2024, this segment will be marked as NO. (b) By August 31, 2024, if agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not completely returned to regular operations after any ongoing labor dispute. The status of the strike or the resumption of work must be validated by official communications from agricultural associations, the unions of the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reliable news sources (like Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have completely resumed work and normal operations have been reinstated prior to or during August 2024, this part will be marked as NO. Partial work returns or limited operations do not qualify as a full resolution of the strike.

question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Sony Corporation not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must not involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (fewer than 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must not last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if a significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Sony Corporation come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if Sony Corporation negotiates a settlement with its unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For the answer to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must include a considerable number of workers from Sony Corporation (minimum of 1,000 participants).
2. The strike should persist for at least one week.
3. The conclusion must be validated by official announcements from both Sony Corporation and the relevant union.
4. The outcome must be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such agreement that meets all these conditions is reached by the given date, or if no significant strike takes place, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

not_P.title: Will the United States not maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States does not continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. If the tariff is maintained at 100% at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

Should the tariff decrease to less than 100% or be entirely eliminated at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, the resolution will be NO. Temporary suspensions or exemptions of the tariff that are clearly defined as temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the outcome of this question.

question.title: Will Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee officially announces a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Sara Lee
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Sara Lee not issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee does not officially announce a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The absence of a recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. No official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. No press release from Sara Lee
3. No announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. No reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The absence of a recall must not explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If such a recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.body:

4. Reports from a minimum of three major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) that cite official sources

The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the withdrawal of the product. If no recall that meets these conditions is announced by the designated date, the inquiry will be considered FALSE.

question.title: Will the E. coli outbreak tied to lettuce result in more than 10 confirmed deaths by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are official reports confirming more than 10 deaths attributed to the E. coli outbreak linked to lettuce from a specific producer. Official confirmation must come from credible sources such as the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or equivalent health authorities, and be reported by at least two reputable news outlets. The death toll must be specifically linked to this outbreak and not include deaths from unrelated E. coli cases. If the death toll remains at 10 or fewer by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, only deaths directly attributed to this specific outbreak will be counted.

not_P.title: Will the E. coli outbreak tied to lettuce result in 10 or fewer confirmed deaths by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are no official reports confirming more than 10 deaths attributed to the E. coli outbreak linked to lettuce from a specific producer. The death toll must be specifically linked to this outbreak and not include deaths from unrelated E. coli cases. If the death toll exceeds 10 by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, only deaths directly attributed to this specific outbreak will be counted.

para_P.title: Will more than 10 confirmed fatalities occur due to the E. coli outbreak associated with lettuce by August 2024?

question.title: Will a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

not_P.title: Will a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio not be canceled by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled. The project must not be completely terminated, meaning it is either still in progress or has not been formally withdrawn or rejected by the state.

para_P.title: Is the factory project of a South Korean battery manufacturer in Ohio going to be scrapped by August 2024?

question.title: Will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points. The 3,500 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. If the index does not reach 3,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.

question.title: Will Andrew Bailey remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Andrew Bailey is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Bailey remaining in the position.

question.title: Will a government-developed AI system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a government-developed AI system is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the government-developed AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the government of Nigeria has not officially reversed its existing ban on cryptocurrency transactions. question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

2. It must not be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must not be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must not be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If such a bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed that meets all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

If no such legislation is enacted by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if legislation is enacted but fails to meet all the aforementioned criteria, the inquiry will conclude as NO.

question.title: Will the Indonesian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Indonesia. The question resolves as NO if the Indonesian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Facebook resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Facebook reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Facebook workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Facebook and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Facebook not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if Facebook does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must not involve a substantial number of Facebook workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must not last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Facebook and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will the Iowa Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Iowa Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. The passage of such legislation must be confirmed through official Iowa legislative records. question.title: Will the Australian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Australian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Australian economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian economy does enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Australian economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Australia steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by the end of July 2024, the Australian economy has not fallen into a recession. For the purposes of this question, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as documented by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. Conversely, the question will be deemed negative if the Australian economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales show a decline for two consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are two consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show a decline compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The declines must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly declines are reported by the resolution date, or if only a single month shows a decline, the question resolves as NO.

If such consecutive monthly declines are reported by the resolution date, or if more than a single month shows a decline, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are two successive months during which the sales of previously occupied homes in the United States exhibit a decrease relative to the month prior. The information must be substantiated by credible sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other esteemed real estate market analysts. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Apple finalize a union contract with store employees in Colorado by July 2024 and (b) the Central Bank of Chile announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Colorado. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If no such finalization and signing of the contract occurs by the specified date, or if the contract is still in a tentative or non-finalized state, the question resolves as NO. (b) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Chile publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate. The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Apple finalize a union contract with store employees in Colorado by July 2024 nor (b) the Central Bank of Chile announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Colorado. The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

If there is no finalization and signing of the contract by the given date, or if the contract remains tentative or not finalized, the inquiry resolves as NO. (b) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Chile makes a public declaration of a reduction in its key interest rate. The announcement must be officially issued by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two trusted financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must pertain to the monetary policy rate, which is the primary instrument of the Central Bank of Chile for impacting the economy. A mere suggestion or speculation regarding potential future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a definitive announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such declaration is made by the specified date, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Fresh Fields Inc. be officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Fresh Fields Inc. is officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak that is different from any previously reported outbreaks. The link must be confirmed by U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must be traced back to products from Fresh Fields Inc. and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. If no such new outbreak is linked to Fresh Fields Inc. by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Fresh Fields Inc. not be officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Fresh Fields Inc. is not officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak that is different from any previously reported outbreaks. The link must not be confirmed by U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA) and not reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must not be traced back to products from Fresh Fields Inc. or must have occurred before October 1, 2023. If such a new outbreak is linked to Fresh Fields Inc. by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to increase the FDA's budget by more than 20% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes an increase of more than 20% in the budget of the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions of budget increases do not count; the bill must be officially passed by the Senate.

question.title: Will Michigan enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Michigan enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local Michigan news stations). The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Michigan. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Michigan not enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Michigan does not enact a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. question.title: Will the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

2. This declaration must not be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must not specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, but rather to a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO makes such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that specifically addresses the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

question.title: Will New Jersey hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, New Jersey officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the New Jersey state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major New Jersey-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in New Jersey and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Indiana enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.

question.title: Will Brazil's Bovespa index reach or exceed 130,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points. The 130,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). If the index does not reach 130,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 130,000 points.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Arizona officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Arizona state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Arizona-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Arizona and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

The referendum must not be open to all eligible voters in Arizona and must not focus primarily on abortion rights. If such a referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is not canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will either Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024 or Wisconsin's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, Arizona officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Arizona state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Arizona-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Arizona and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO. (b) By August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Wisconsin's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Wisconsin state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, this part of the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023. The combined question resolves as YES if either (a) or (b) resolves as YES.

not_P.title: Will neither Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024 nor Wisconsin's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, Arizona officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Arizona state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Arizona-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Arizona and focus primarily on abortion rights. If such a referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is not canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as YES. (b) By August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Wisconsin's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Wisconsin state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it constitutional, this part of the question resolves as YES. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023. The combined question resolves as YES if neither (a) nor (b) resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Arizona will conduct a referendum on abortion rights before July 2024, or that Wisconsin's nearly complete abortion prohibition will be upheld as constitutional by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following takes place: (a) By July 31, 2024, Arizona holds an official statewide referendum specifically aimed at establishing abortion rights within the state constitution. This referendum must be publicly announced by the Arizona state government and confirmed by at least two major news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or significant Arizona news outlets). The referendum should be accessible to all eligible voters in Arizona and primarily concentrate on abortion rights. If such a referendum is not conducted or finalized by the resolution date, or if it is canceled or delayed past July 31, 2024, this segment of the question will resolve as NO. (b) By August 31, 2024, a judicial decision affirms the constitutionality of Wisconsin's near-total abortion prohibition. This affirmation must originate from a Wisconsin state court and be reported by at least two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the prohibition is not confirmed as constitutional by the given date, or if a court rules against its constitutionality, this part of the question will resolve as NO. For this question, a 'near-total abortion prohibition' refers to the law that was blocked and is awaiting evaluation, as referenced in the article dated October 1, 2023. The overall question will resolve as YES if either (a) or (b) is answered with YES.

question.title: Will New York City announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of New York City officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within New York City's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will New York City not announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of New York City does not officially announce plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must not come from an official source within New York City's local government and not be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should not be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will be sufficient for a NO resolution. If such an official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that New York City will reveal plans to limit short-term rental units by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, the New York City government formally discloses plans or regulations intended to restrict or control the number of short-term rental units (such as those commonly found on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must originate from an official New York City government source and be covered by at least two credible international news outlets. The regulations or plans should specifically aim to decrease the availability of short-term rental units for tourists or modify their operational framework. Simply having discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not suffice for a TRUE resolution. If no such official statement is issued by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves as FALSE.

question.title: Will the median Canadian home price reach a new record high by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the median price of existing homes sold in Canada reaches a new record high, surpassing any previous monthly median price on record. The record must be confirmed by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other widely recognized real estate data providers such as Royal LePage or RE/MAX. The median price refers to the middle price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. If no new record high is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported median price does not exceed the current record, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question focuses on the nominal price, not adjusted for inflation.

not_P.title: Will the median Canadian home price not reach a new record high by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the median price of existing homes sold in Canada does not reach a new record high, failing to surpass any previous monthly median price on record. The absence of a record must be confirmed by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other widely recognized real estate data providers such as Royal LePage or RE/MAX. The median price refers to the middle price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. If a new record high is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported median price exceeds the current record, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question focuses on the nominal price, not adjusted for inflation.

This record must be validated by information from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other reputable real estate data sources such as Royal LePage or RE/MAX. The average price indicates the midpoint price in the spectrum of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. If no new all-time high is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported average price does not surpass the existing record, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that this question pertains to the nominal price, not adjusted for inflation.

question.title: Will the Australian Government announce conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian Government officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official government channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the government fleet or directly associated with governmental transportation. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

not_P.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims not exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, does not exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. It will be answered with a NO if this scenario does not occur within the designated period. For the purpose of resolution, only official figures released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account.

question.title: Will US airline mechanics remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, airline mechanics in the United States are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from the airlines, the unions representing the mechanics, or the US government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as The New York Times, CNN, or Reuters). If the mechanics have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

Any partial return to work or limited operational capacity does not equate to a full resolution of the strike.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Singapore announce a new exchange rate policy by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Singapore officially announces a new exchange rate policy. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Singapore communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore. The announcement should explicitly describe the new exchange rate policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Singapore maintains the current exchange rate policy, the question resolves as NO.

The announcement should not explicitly describe the new exchange rate policy. The announcement must not be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Singapore does not maintain the current exchange rate policy, the question resolves as NO.

This declaration must originate from an authorized communication channel of the Central Bank of Singapore, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore. (a) The Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. (b) The Central Bank of Singapore officially announces a new exchange rate policy by August 31, 2024. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Singapore communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore. The announcement should explicitly describe the new exchange rate policy. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Singapore maintains the current exchange rate policy, this component resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both components (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will General Motors resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if General Motors reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of General Motors workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both General Motors and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will LG Electronics resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if LG Electronics reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of LG Electronics workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both LG Electronics and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will LG Electronics not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of LG Electronics workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both LG Electronics and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if a significant strike does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will LG Electronics come to an agreement to end a significant labor strike by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if LG Electronics successfully negotiates with the unionized workforce, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. To be deemed valid:

1. The strike must engage a considerable number of LG Electronics employees (a minimum of 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must persist for no less than one week.
3. Confirmation of the resolution must be provided through official announcements from both LG Electronics and the relevant union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If an agreement that satisfies all these conditions is not reached by the stated date, or if no significant strike occurs, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US fall below 6.2% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 6.2% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 6.2% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 6.2% will not be considered as falling below 6.2%.

question.title: Will Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season does not meet these criteria, or if insufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia does not report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields not meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The lack of success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or by fewer than three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'not successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being less than 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season meets these criteria, or if sufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Russian government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announcement only reaffirms or provides updates on the existing two-reactor plan, the question will resolve as NO.

If neither of these criteria are fulfilled by their respective deadlines, the question will be answered in the negative.

question.title: Will Indiana hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Indiana officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Indiana state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Indiana-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Indiana and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

not_P.title: Will Indiana not hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?

If such a referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is not canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

The plan must not be officially adopted, merely proposed or under consideration. If at least one other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.
