question.title: Will the United Nations Development Programme announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the United Nations Development Programme not announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme does not officially announce one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must not be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and not be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must not be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, and must be continuations of previously announced commitments. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments exceeds $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the United Nations Development Programme will declare new financial commitments exceeding $400 million by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme formally declares one or multiple new financial commitments that together surpass $400 million. The declaration(s) must occur via official UNDP channels (like their website or press releases) and must be reported by at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The financial commitments must represent new initiatives or substantial expansions of current programs, not merely continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new financial commitments does not exceed $400 million, the inquiry resolves as FALSE.

question.title: Will a major hospital system in France cancel over €250 million in medical debt by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple regions. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is €250 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will a major hospital system in France not cancel over €250 million in medical debt by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, does not successfully cancel more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple regions. The cancellation must not be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should not target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is €250 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a significant healthcare network in France to eliminate over €250 million in medical debt by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, a healthcare network located in France, in partnership with a nonprofit organization, manages to eliminate more than €250 million in medical debt for no fewer than 150,000 patients across various regions. The debt relief must be officially declared by the healthcare network or covered by at least two major news organizations (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or prominent national newspapers). The debt forgiveness should focus on patients identified as financially disadvantaged or unable to settle their bills. If the debt elimination is not finalized or officially acknowledged by the specified deadline, or if the total amount forgiven is €250 million or less, the inquiry will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The United Nations Development Programme announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million, and (b) A major hospital system in France cancels over €250 million in medical debt?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur: (a) By July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. (b) By August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple regions. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The United Nations Development Programme announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million, nor (b) A major hospital system in France cancels over €250 million in medical debt?

The cancellation must not be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should not target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If either condition (a) or (b) is met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) The United Nations Development Programme reveals new funding pledges exceeding $400 million, and (b) A significant hospital organization in France eliminates over €250 million in medical debt?

The funding must pertain to new initiatives or considerable expansions of existing programs, rather than being continuations of prior commitments. This debt forgiveness must be officially declared by the hospital organization or reported by at least two prominent news outlets (including Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt relief should focus on patients deemed financially disadvantaged or unable to afford payment. If either condition (a) or (b) is unmet, the resolution will be NO.

These commitments must represent new projects or substantial expansions, not mere continuations of earlier commitments. If neither of these events takes place by their specified deadlines, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Google lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Google has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Google confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

not_P.title: Will Google not lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Google has not confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must not come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must not be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Google confirms a higher number of layoffs, or if such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Confirmation of layoffs that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will at least 1,800 employees be laid off by Google before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved in the affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, Google has officially verified the termination of at least 1,800 employees as part of its reorganization strategy focused on AI. Verification must be derived from official company statements, regulatory documents, or reports from a minimum of two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be directly associated with the AI-centric reorganization plan that was announced in 2023. If Google verifies a lesser number of layoffs, or if no confirmation that meets these requirements is provided by the resolution deadline, the inquiry will be resolved in the negative. Any partial layoffs or staged implementations that do not achieve the 1,800 employee mark by the resolution date will also lead to a negative resolution.

question.title: Will the South African Reserve Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the South African Reserve Bank officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the South African Reserve Bank or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual SARB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the South African Reserve Bank not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the South African Reserve Bank does not officially announce a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through no official statements from the South African Reserve Bank or reported by fewer than two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must not be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual SARB members will not count for resolution. If such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the South African Reserve Bank declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if the South African Reserve Bank formally announces a reduction in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The declaration must be validated through official communications from the South African Reserve Bank or reported by at least two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their official statement or press conference after a meeting. Any conjecture about potential future rate reductions or unofficial remarks by individual SARB members will not be considered for resolution. If no such official declaration of an interest rate reduction is made by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Google lays off at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, and (b) The South African Reserve Bank announces an interest rate cut?

(b) The South African Reserve Bank officially announces a decrease in its repo rate, confirmed through official statements from the South African Reserve Bank or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. If either condition is not met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Google lays off at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, nor (b) The South African Reserve Bank announces an interest rate cut?

The layoffs must not be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. (b) The South African Reserve Bank does not officially announce a decrease in its repo rate, confirmed through no official statements from the South African Reserve Bank or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must not be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. If both conditions are met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as YES.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of these events take place: (a) Google will have laid off a minimum of 1,800 employees as part of its reorganization plan focused on AI, and (b) The South African Reserve Bank will declare a reduction in interest rates?

The layoffs must be directly associated with the AI-centered reorganization strategy introduced in 2023. (b) The South African Reserve Bank formally announces a cut in its repo rate, verified through official communications from the South African Reserve Bank or reported by at least two prominent financial news agencies (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their formal statement or press briefing after a meeting. If either requirement is not fulfilled by the resolution date, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Will either Google lay off at least 1,800 employees due to its AI-focused reorganization plan or the South African Reserve Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) Google confirms the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, with confirmation coming from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. question.title: Will Texas hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on abortion rights. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address abortion rights, either proposing to enshrine protections or to restrict/ban abortion. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on abortion does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Shanghai Composite index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Shanghai Composite index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Shanghai Stock Exchange. question.title: Will Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in New York City by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in New York City, New York. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. question.title: Will Maryland hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Maryland officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Maryland state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Maryland-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Maryland and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

The referendum must not be formally announced by the Maryland state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Maryland-based news outlets). The referendum must not be open to all eligible voters in Maryland and must not focus primarily on abortion rights. If such a referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is not canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris announces her running mate at a rally in New York City by August 2024 and (b) Maryland holds a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?

question.title: Will Oregon receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Oregon is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within Oregon. If the total amount of such grants awarded to Oregon does not exceed $300 million by the specified date, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil announce a new inflation target by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Brazil officially announces a new inflation target. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Brazil communication channel, such as a press release, monetary policy statement, or a public speech by the President of the Central Bank of Brazil. The announcement should explicitly state the new inflation target. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Brazil maintains the current inflation target, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Canada specifically in response to the government's decision to change environmental policies. question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles through August 2024?

If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. 3. The legal action must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets.

question.title: Will Zoom lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Zoom has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Zoom confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

The layoffs must not be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. Any layoffs that do reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Kansas hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Kansas officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the Kansas state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will Kansas not hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Kansas does not officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must not be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must not be officially announced by the Kansas state government and the voting process must not be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must not be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If such a referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is Kansas set to conduct a vote on abortion rights before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Kansas officially carries out a statewide vote specifically addressing abortion rights. question.title: Will the Bank of Canada announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of Canada officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Canada communications, such as press releases, Governing Council statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the overnight rate, which is the Bank of Canada's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will Apple Inc. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Apple Inc. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Apple Inc. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Apple Inc. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Pedro Sánchez remain the Prime Minister of Spain through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Pedro Sánchez continues to hold the position of Prime Minister of Spain through July 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if Sánchez leaves or is removed from the position at any point before or during July 2024. For the purpose of this question, temporary absences due to illness or vacation do not count as leaving the position.

question.title: Will Louisiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Louisiana's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Louisiana state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

not_P.title: Will Louisiana's near-total abortion ban not be declared constitutional by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the unconstitutionality of Louisiana's near-total abortion ban. question.title: Will Missouri conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Missouri conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Missouri.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will Missouri not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Missouri does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the state of Missouri.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.body:

1. The public vote must be formally declared and executed by the state of Missouri.
2. The main emphasis of the public vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The results of the public vote must be disclosed by official state sources or widely acknowledged news outlets.

If no such public vote fulfilling these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a public vote without it actually being held by the specified deadline does not qualify for a YES outcome.

question.title: Will Green Acres Co. be officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak by July 2024?

The link must be confirmed by U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must be traced back to products from Green Acres Co. and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. (b) The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground basil products due to lead contamination. The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. If neither condition is met by the resolution date, the question resolves as YES.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Green Acres Co. is officially associated with a new salmonella outbreak, and (b) the FDA announces a recall of ground basil products because of lead contamination?

The outbreak must be traced back to products from Green Acres Co. and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. (b) The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) must officially announce a recall for any ground basil products due to lead contamination. This recall must be confirmed through official FDA statements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for producers to withdraw their products from the market. Alerts or warnings without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. If both criteria are not fulfilled by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Nigeria's Senate not pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate does not pass a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If such a bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed that meets all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Nigeria's legislative body approve a significant economic reform proposal that President Tinubu opposes before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's legislative body approves a significant economic reform proposal that is directly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The proposal must pertain to economic policy, including areas such as fiscal expenditure, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be approved by the legislative body, irrespective of whether it is enacted into law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news agencies (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The proposal must be characterized as 'significant' or 'major' by these news agencies in terms of its potential effects on the Nigerian economy.

If no such proposal is approved by the legislative body by August 31, 2024, or if a proposal is approved but does not fulfill all the aforementioned criteria, the inquiry resolves as FALSE.

question.title: Will Bayer allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Bayer officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Bayer continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Bayer not allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Bayer does not officially announce or confirm that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively enforcing its patent. This could be through a lack of formal patent withdrawal, a lack of voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that does not allow for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must not come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If such an announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Bayer does not continue to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Bayer permit the creation of generic versions of its heart medication by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Bayer publicly declares or verifies that it will permit the creation of generic versions of its heart medication, thereby choosing not to enforce its patent rights. This could occur through an official withdrawal of the patent, a voluntary licensing agreement, or any other means that facilitates unrestricted generic manufacturing. Verification must come from official announcements by the company, statements from relevant regulatory authorities, or reports from at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such declaration or verification is made by the given date, or if Bayer continues to uphold its patent rights, the inquiry will be answered with a NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Bayer officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers).

If both (a) and (b) occur by their respective dates, the question resolves as YES. If either (a) or (b) does not occur by the specified dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce a new monetary easing policy by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces a new monetary easing policy. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Indonesia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia. The announcement should explicitly describe the new monetary easing policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Indonesia maintains the current policy stance, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia not announce a new monetary easing policy by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Indonesia does not officially announce a new monetary easing policy. The announcement must not come from an official Central Bank of Indonesia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia. The announcement should not explicitly describe the new monetary easing policy. The announcement must not be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Indonesia changes the current policy stance, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Bank Indonesia make a declaration regarding a new monetary easing strategy before August 2024?

The announcement must clearly outline the new monetary easing strategy. Additionally, it must be reported by at least two prominent financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered legitimate. If no such declaration occurs by the specified date, or if Bank Indonesia continues with the current policy, the inquiry will resolve as negative.

question.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

question.title: Will TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. question.title: Will the United States report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current West Nile virus outbreak over by August 2024?

The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

4. No reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The absence of a recall must not explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.0% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 5.0% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 5.0% will not be considered as falling below 5.0%.

question.title: Will Jerome Powell remain as Federal Reserve Chair through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Jerome Powell is still serving as the Chair of the Federal Reserve on July 31, 2024. If he is no longer serving as Chair by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Chair appointments will not be considered as Powell remaining in the position.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Miami by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Miami, Florida. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Miami rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris does not publicly announce her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Miami, Florida. If Harris does make such an announcement at a Miami rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Vice President Kamala Harris reveal her choice for running mate during a Miami rally before the end of August 2024?

question.title: Will New Jersey conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New Jersey conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New Jersey.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will New Jersey not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New Jersey does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the state of New Jersey.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is there a plan for New Jersey to hold a vote on abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if, by August 31, 2024, New Jersey holds a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights in the state. For an affirmative resolution, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The vote must be officially declared and executed by the state of New Jersey.
2. The main purpose of the vote must be centered on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the vote must be disclosed through official state communications or reputable news outlets.

If such a vote fulfilling these conditions does not take place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered negatively. It is important to note that simply suggesting or organizing a vote without actual execution by the stated date does not meet the criteria for an affirmative resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Kamala Harris announces her running mate at a rally in Miami, and (b) New Jersey conducts a referendum on abortion rights?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following events occur by August 31, 2024:

(a) Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Miami, Florida. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally.

(b) New Jersey conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New Jersey.
   2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If either of these events does not occur by the end of August 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will a major social media platform be reported for spreading election misinformation through its AI systems by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the platform and its AI systems' role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

The reports or alerts must explicitly refer to the platform and its AI technologies' involvement in disseminating election-related misinformation. If no such reports or alerts are made by the resolution date, the inquiry will be answered negatively.

question.title: Will Nicolas Maduro publicly condemn the attack on Maria Corina Machado's headquarters by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro makes a public statement specifically condemning the attack on Maria Corina Machado's headquarters that occurred in 2023. The statement must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or similar). The condemnation must be explicit and unambiguous, directly addressing the attack on Machado's headquarters. If no such condemnation is made by the resolution date, or if the condemnation is vague or does not specifically mention the attack on Machado's headquarters, the question resolves as NO.

The statement must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or similar). The condemnation must not be explicit and unambiguous, and must not directly address the attack on Machado's headquarters. If such a condemnation is made by the resolution date, or if the condemnation is vague or does not specifically mention the attack on Machado's headquarters, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a mental health support requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a mental health support requirement for beneficiaries. The mental health support requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will no other U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan without a mental health support requirement by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, no U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a mental health support requirement for beneficiaries. The mental health support requirement must not be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be no official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post) regarding such a plan. The plan must not be officially adopted, merely proposed or under consideration. If any other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will any other state in the U.S. implement a Medicaid program that mandates mental health support by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, at least one state in the U.S., excluding Georgia, formally implements a Medicaid program that requires mental health support for its beneficiaries. The mental health support requirement must be an essential aspect of the program. For a positive outcome, there must be an official declaration from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent coverage from a minimum of two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The program must be officially enacted, not just suggested or being evaluated. If no other state establishes such a program by July 31, 2024, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will Missouri hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?

The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. (b) Oracle officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Oracle's AI systems. If either announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Reserve Bank of India will reduce interest rates or that Oracle will implement strategies to lower electricity usage related to AI by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as YES if one of the following happens by July 31, 2024: (a) The Reserve Bank of India makes an official declaration of a reduction in its repo rate. This announcement must be verified through formal communications from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two prominent financial news organizations (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their official statement or press briefing after a meeting. Any conjecture regarding future rate reductions or informal comments from individual RBI members will not be considered for resolution. (b) Oracle makes an official announcement of specific initiatives aimed at decreasing the electricity consumption linked to its AI operations. This announcement must be made through official corporate channels (like press releases, blog entries, or annual reports) or covered by at least two major media outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The initiatives announced should consist of tangible actions or programs designed to reduce the energy consumption of Oracle's AI systems. If neither announcement occurs by the indicated date, the question will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will President Biden deliver a speech at a National Education Association event in Illinois by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, President Joe Biden delivers a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Illinois. The speech must be confirmed by official White House announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If no such speech occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will President Biden not deliver a speech at a National Education Association event in Illinois by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, President Joe Biden does not deliver a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Illinois. The speech must not be confirmed by official White House announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If such a speech occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that President Biden will speak at a National Education Association event in Illinois before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, President Joe Biden addresses any event organized by the National Education Association (NEA) in Illinois. The speech must be verified through official announcements from the White House or reports from a minimum of two credible news outlets. If there is no occurrence of such a speech by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will California receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of California is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within California. If the total amount of such grants awarded to California does not exceed $300 million by the specified date, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will California receive no more than $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of California is confirmed to have been awarded no more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within California. If the total amount of such grants awarded to California exceeds $300 million by the specified date, or if there is sufficient evidence to confirm such an award, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that California will obtain more than $300 million in federal funding for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, it is verified that California has received in excess of $300 million in federal funding specifically allocated for electric vehicle production, assembly, or associated projects. Verification must be provided by official U.S. government agencies (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or reported by at least two prominent national media outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding must be clearly designated for electric vehicle-related efforts within California. If the total federal funding awarded to California does not surpass $300 million by the indicated date, or if there is inadequate evidence to substantiate such an award, the inquiry will be considered FALSE.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) President Biden delivers a speech at a National Education Association event in Illinois, and (b) California receives over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) President Joe Biden delivers a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Illinois, confirmed by official White House announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources; and (b) the state of California is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects, with confirmation from official U.S. government sources or reports by at least two major national news organizations. question.title: Will a major hospital system in the Northeast US cancel over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in the Northeast United States, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple Northeastern states. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is $300 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will a major hospital system in the Northeast US not cancel over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in the Northeast United States, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, does not successfully cancel more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple Northeastern states. The cancellation must not be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should not target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is more than $300 million, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a significant healthcare network in the Northeastern United States to eliminate more than $300 million in medical debt by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, a healthcare network located in the Northeastern United States, in partnership with a nonprofit entity, successfully forgives over $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients in various Northeastern states. The debt relief must be officially announced by the healthcare network or covered by at least two prominent news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt forgiveness should focus on patients deemed financially vulnerable or unable to afford payments. If the debt relief is not finalized or officially verified by the given date, or if the amount forgiven is $300 million or less, the inquiry will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, or if a significant strike does not occur, the question resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company successfully negotiates with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. To be considered valid for resolution:

1. The strike must involve a considerable number of Hyundai Motor Company employees (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike should continue for a minimum of one week.
3. The resolution must be validated by official announcements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the participating union.
4. The resolution must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no resolution meeting all these conditions is reached by the given date, or if no significant strike takes place, the question resolves as NO.

The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is $300 million or less, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. The strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants) and last for at least one week. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) A major hospital system in the Northeast US cancels over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024 (b) Hyundai Motor Company resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024?

question.title: Will Virginia maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

not_P.title: Will Virginia not maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not reversed this decision, has not reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or has not reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

para_P.title: Will Virginia uphold its existing legal position regarding abortion access by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has neither overturned nor significantly modified its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a widely used second-trimester procedure. Conversely, the question will be answered with a NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has overturned this ruling, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reintroduced the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The outcome will depend on official court rulings or credible information from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will both Virginia and Florida maintain their current legal stances on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, both the Virginia Supreme Court and the Florida Supreme Court have not reversed or significantly altered their 2023 decisions that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. para_P.title: Will the current legal positions regarding abortion access in Virginia and Florida remain unchanged by July 2024?

(b) The Florida Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on healthcare reform in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Georgia.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on healthcare reform.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum occurs or is completed by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Proposed referendums that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date do not count for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Chile announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Chile publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

If no such declaration occurs by the stated deadline, the inquiry will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales show a decline for two consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are two consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show a decline compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The declines must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly declines are reported by the resolution date, or if only a single month shows a decline, the question resolves as NO.
