question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will the World Health Organization not declare the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must not be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If such a declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO does not extend the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce the conclusion of the current SARS-CoV-2 epidemic by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) formally announces that the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 epidemic is concluded by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be validated through official communications from the WHO or reports from a minimum of three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The epidemic referenced in this inquiry is the one that led the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If no official declaration ending the epidemic is issued by the resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will the Bahraini health ministry confirm more than one case of polio in Manama by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. For the purpose of this question:

1. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements.
2. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
3. The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023.
4. Only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered.
5. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question.

If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Bahraini health ministry confirm no more than one case of polio in Manama by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Bahraini health ministry officially confirms no more than one case of polio in Manama. For the purpose of this question:

1. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements.
2. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
3. The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023.
4. Only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered.
5. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question.

If more than one case is confirmed by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, the Bahraini health ministry officially acknowledges more than one instance of polio in Manama. For the context of this inquiry:

1. Acknowledgment must be derived from official reports or statements from the Bahraini health ministry.
2. The acknowledgment must be corroborated by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
3. The instances must be new and distinct from any reported prior to October 1, 2023.
4. Only instances occurring within the geographic confines of Manama will be taken into account.
5. The specific type of polio (whether wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) is irrelevant for this inquiry.

If no further instances beyond the first are acknowledged by the specified deadline, or if only a single instance in total is acknowledged, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) the WHO declares the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over and (b) the Bahraini health ministry confirms more than one case of polio in Manama?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur by August 31, 2024:

(a) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) The Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements, and be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera). The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023, and only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered. The type of polio does not matter. If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, this part will resolve as NO.

The combined question will resolve as YES only if both parts (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by August 2024: (a) the WHO declares the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over nor (b) the Bahraini health ministry confirms more than one case of polio in Manama?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occur by August 31, 2024:

(a) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over. The outbreak referred to is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as YES.

(b) The Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. Confirmation must not come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements, and not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera). The cases must not be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023, and only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered. question.title: Will the Indian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation of India. The question resolves as NO if the Indian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

2. The main emphasis of the public vote must be on the protection of abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the public vote must be disclosed by official state communications or widely acknowledged news outlets.

If no such public vote that meets these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be deemed negative. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a public vote without actually executing it by the given date does not warrant an affirmative resolution.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Charlotte by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Charlotte, North Carolina. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. question.title: Will Rome announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of Rome officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within Rome's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage exceed 7.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 7.0%. question.title: Will the South Korean economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The question resolves as NO if the South Korean economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, not a global Lassa fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Lassa fever that does not specifically address the Nigerian outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the WHO not declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
not_P.body:

1. The WHO must not make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must not be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must not specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, but rather to a global Lassa fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO makes such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Lassa fever that specifically addresses the Nigerian outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce that the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially states that the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria is no longer deemed a global emergency. For a YES outcome:

1. The WHO must issue a public statement clearly indicating that the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria is no longer classified as a global emergency.
2. This statement must be covered by at least two prominent international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The statement must specifically mention the Nigerian Lassa fever situation, rather than a general global context regarding Lassa fever.

The inquiry will result in a NO if:
1. The WHO does not issue such a statement by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO releases a statement about Lassa fever that does not specifically pertain to the Nigerian situation.
3. The WHO either maintains or increases the emergency designation of the Nigerian Lassa fever situation.

Note: If the WHO has previously declared the Nigerian Lassa fever situation to no longer be a global emergency before the start date of this inquiry, the outcome will still be based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will a new AI platform be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a new AI platform is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris not announce her running mate at a rally in San Francisco by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris does not publicly announce her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in San Francisco, California. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does make such an announcement at a San Francisco rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Kamala Harris will reveal her choice for running mate at a San Francisco rally before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris officially discloses her selected running mate for the forthcoming election during a rally in San Francisco, California. The revelation must come directly from Harris at the rally and must explicitly name the person she has chosen as her running mate. The occurrence of this event and the announcement must be validated by at least two credible national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours following the rally. If Harris fails to make such a declaration at a rally in San Francisco by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is communicated through alternative methods or at a different venue, the inquiry will be considered FALSE.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Indiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional and (b) Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in San Francisco?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) A court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Indiana's near-total abortion ban, with confirmation from an Indiana state court and reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). The 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023. (b) Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in San Francisco, California, with the announcement made by Harris herself during the rally, clearly identifying the individual chosen as her running mate, and confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If either or both of these events do not occur by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

not_P.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index not reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?

It is important to note that intraday peaks are considered for resolution; the index is not required to close at or above 4,000 points.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current bird flu outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing bird flu outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.
